page.title: 17Hadstock Grain Store
page.content: One of the old hangars on Hadstock airfield has been extended by the addition of three other large buildings, to provide grain storage space. There are several similar stores in north-west Essex. This one is owned by Dalgety's, who buy wheat, barley and rape from local farmers, but they also provide storage space for other customers. As well as the large storage sheds, there is a smaller building which houses an office, a laboratory and a weighbridge. The grain is sampled and tested as it arrives, and may be stored for months. A check is kept on its condition while it is stored, and when it leaves. The grain-store has been there for about twenty years. It employs five or six people.
